notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Gaps after folios 29 and 48. Stained, partly water-damaged.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Nur al-tsulm, an Arabic-Hebrew midrashic commentary on the Pentateuch by Nathanael ben Isaiah.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each. Signed with Hebrew letters on the last and first page of a quire.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Nur Uz-Zulm. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2356.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Nicolas Mavrocordato: purchased by the British Museum from him on 28 May, 1881: inscribed, [289v].
